hero.headline: Claude-Mem Explodes: Session Memory Plugin Gains 633 Stars as Developers Demand Persistent AI Context
hero.summary: The claude-mem plugin shot up GitHub trending today, gaining 633 stars as developers embrace persistent memory for Claude Code sessions. Built using Claude's agent-sdk, it automatically captures everything Claude does during coding sessions, compresses the activity with AI, and injects relevant context back into future sessions.
hero.whyItMatters: This addresses the #1 frustration with AI coding agents: context amnesia. Every new session starts from scratch, forcing developers to re-explain their codebase, preferences, and project state. Claude-mem creates a continuous memory layer that makes each session smarter than the last. The explosive adoption signals that 'stateful AI' is becoming a must-have, not a nice-to-have.

topStories.title: byLLM Framework: Add AI to Software with One Line of Code - No Prompt Engineering Required
topStories.summary: The byLLM open-source framework eliminates manual prompt engineering by enabling seamless LLM integration with a single line of code. In evaluations at SPLASH conference, byLLM achieved higher accuracy and better runtime performance than DSPy, with developers completing tasks 3x faster using 45% fewer lines of code.

topStories.title: Claude Code 2.0.70: Enter Key for Prompts, MCP Wildcards, and Plan Mode Approval
topStories.summary: Today's Claude Code release brings quality-of-life improvements: Enter now accepts and submits prompt suggestions immediately, new mcp__server__* wildcard syntax for tool permissions, auto-update toggle per plugin marketplace, and plan_mode_required parameter for teammate spawning.

topStories.title: Building an AI Employee That ACTUALLY Works: Opus 4.5 + Obsidian Integration
topStories.summary: Riley Brown's 24-minute deep dive demonstrates building a functional AI employee using Claude Opus 4.5 integrated with Obsidian for knowledge management. The video gained 25K+ views as developers seek practical workflows for delegating real work to AI agents.

topStories.title: ConvertX: Self-Hosted File Converter Supporting 1000+ Formats Goes Viral
topStories.summary: ConvertX exploded on GitHub with 614 stars today as developers embrace self-hosted alternatives. The TypeScript-based tool converts between 1000+ file formats locally, appealing to privacy-conscious teams who want AI-assisted document processing without cloud dependencies.

trendingSkills.name: LangGraph Patterns Expert
trendingSkills.description: Advanced LangGraph agent design patterns including explicit state management, small composable nodes, and clear state transitions for building production-grade AI workflows.

trendingSkills.name: Debugging with Tools
trendingSkills.description: Investigation-first debugging methodology. Uses tool-driven evidence gathering (search, logs, diffs) before making any code changes. Prevents premature fixes.

trendingSkills.description: Docker and Kubernetes troubleshooting patterns. Inspect runtime state and logs before changing images or manifests. Essential for containerized AI deployments.

newMcpServers.name: hoverfly-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Exposes Hoverfly as a programmable mock for AI assistants. Dynamically mock third-party APIs to unblock development, automate testing, and simulate unavailable services during integration.

newMcpServers.name: dynatrace-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Brings real-time observability data from Dynatrace directly into your development workflow. Query metrics, analyze logs, and debug performance issues through AI agents.

newMcpServers.name: okta-mcp-fctr
newMcpServers.description: Secure Okta identity and access management via MCP. Access users, groups, applications, logs, and policies through AI assistants with enterprise-grade security.

newMcpServers.name: unreal-engine-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Control Unreal Engine via Remote Control API. Enable AI assistants to automate game development tasks, scene manipulation, and asset management in UE5.

notableHooks.name: Skill Auto-Activation
notableHooks.description: Automatically suggests relevant skills based on user prompts and file context. The key hook that makes Claude Code skills auto-activate without manual invocation.

notableHooks.name: Edit Tracker
notableHooks.description: Tracks all file modifications with Edit|MultiEdit|Write matcher. Logs changes for audit trails, enables undo functionality, and supports automated commit workflows.

notableHooks.name: Multi-Agent Observability
notableHooks.description: Real-time monitoring for Claude Code agents through comprehensive hook event tracking. Capture, store, and visualize events across multiple concurrent agent sessions.

trendingVideos.title: I'll never use n8n the same......
i think this is what AI should look like
AI News: GPT-5.2, Devstral 2, Boom Superpower, MCP Nonprofit and more!
I Built an AI Employee That ACTUALLY Works For Me (Opus 4.5 + Obsidian)

highlights: Enter key now accepts and submits prompt suggestions immediately (Tab still allows editing)
MCP tool permission wildcards: mcp__server__* syntax to allow/deny all tools from a server
Plan mode approval parameter: plan_mode_required for teammate spawning
Persistent 'Always Allow' policies with granular shell and MCP support
GEMINI_API_KEY environment variable now takes priority for authentication
Tool output fragmentation fix by encapsulating content in functionResponse
Remote compaction enabled for API-key based sessions
Cloud exec --branch for remote runs with status/diff/apply flows

notableQuotes.quote: Developers using byLLM completed tasks over three times faster and wrote 45% fewer lines of code compared to manual prompt engineering frameworks like DSPy.
notableQuotes.author: TechXplore

notableQuotes.quote: Context engineering is replacing prompt engineering as the new frontier of control. It's not about clever wording anymore - it's about designing environments where AI can think with depth, consistency, and purpose.
notableQuotes.author: KDnuggets

notableQuotes.quote: Study participants reported that dynamic controls made it easier to express the nuances of their tasks without repeatedly rephrasing prompts, reducing the effort of prompt engineering.
notableQuotes.author: Microsoft Research

prompt: Generated via /generate-news slash command. Claude fetches data from 9 sources in parallel (aggregated RSS feed, 7 web searches, GitHub trending via trotd, SkillsMP feed, Claude Code/Gemini CLI/Codex changelogs, Docker MCP catalog via mcp-find, YouTube trending API, Claude Code hooks docs, awesome-tuis list), deduplicates against the past 7 days of digests, then curates into structured JSON.
